concept.title: Generic button API
concept.shortdesc: The Generic button API is used for enabling touch support for buttons.

conbody.p: An Avkon button is a generic button component specifically designed for touch support. The generic button component (CAknButton, defined in aknbutton.h) is used, for example, in a toolbar and a status pane. The button can contain text, an image, or both.

By default, the button has a frame, it responds to tap (press) event, has a latchable view in the pressed-down state, and has horizontally and vertically aligned text in it. Some default behavior can be changed with button flags or with the help of member functions.
To observe the buttons in your application, use the MCoeControlObserver observer interface.

fig.title: Generic button used in a toolbar

note.p: The Generic button API is used for creating buttons that are displayed as parts of container components, such as a toolbar. It is not used for creating CBA buttons displayed in the control pane at the bottom of the device screen. The API for creating CBA buttons is the Buttons API.

conbody.p: For look and feel guidelines on the generic button component as part of a toolbar, see the toolbar UI component description.
For information on using the API, see Enabling touch support for buttons.
For the Generic button API classes and header files, see Classes and Definitions.

section.title: Constraints
section.p: This API is valid for all platforms running on Symbian OS v9.3 or later.
